ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The endpoint(4) URL that is returned by either the Autodiscover Publishing Lookup SOAP-Based Web Service Protocol, as described in [MS-OXWSADISC], or the Autodiscover Publishing and Lookup Protocol, as described in [MS-OXDSCLI], is required to form the HTTP request to the Web server that hosts this protocol [MS-OXWSCORE].

[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The operations that this protocol [MS-OXWSCORE] defines cannot be accessed unless the correct endpoint (4) is identified in the HTTP Web requests that target this protocol [MS-OXWSCORE].
[In Messages] In the following sections [section 2], the schema definition might differ from the processing rules imposed by the protocol [MS-OXWSCORE].
[In Messages] The WSDL in this specification [MS-OXWSCORE] provides a base description of the protocol [MS-OXWSCORE].
[In Messages] The schema in this specification [MS-OXWSCORE] provides a base description of the message syntax.
[In Messages] The text that specifies the WSDL and schema might specify restrictions that reflect actual protocol behavior.

[In Messages] For example, the schema definition might allow for an element to be empty, null, or not present but the behavior of the protocol as specified restricts the same elements to being non-empty, not null, or present.
[In Transport] The SOAP version supported is SOAP 1.1.
[In Transport] For details, see [SOAP1.1].
[In Transport] This protocol [MS-OXWSCORE] relies on the Web server that hosts the application to perform authentication.
[In Transport] Protocol servers MUST support SOAP over HTTP.
[In Transport] The protocol [MS-OXWSCORE] SHOULD use secure communications via HTTPS, as defined in [RFC2818].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1006.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Common Message Syntax] This section contains common definitions that are used by this protocol [MS-OXWSCORE].
[In Common Message Syntax] The syntax of the definitions uses XML schema, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA1] and [XMLSCHEMA2], and Web Services Description Language (WSDL), as defined in [WSDL].
[In Common Message Syntax] The syntax of the definitions uses XML schema, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA1] and [XMLSCHEMA2], and Web Services Description Language (WSDL), as defined in [WSDL].

[In Namespaces] Although this specification [MS-OXWSCORE] associates a specific XML namespace prefix for each XML namespace that is used, the choice of any particular XML namespace prefix is implementation-specific and not significant for interoperability.
[In Namespaces] The prefix "soap" is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/ " and reference [SOAP1.1].
[In Namespaces] The prefix "tns" is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.microsoft.com/exchange/services/2006/messages".
[In Namespaces] The prefix "s" is used Namespace URI "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema " and reference [XMLSCHEMA1].
[In Namespaces] The prefix "targetNamespace" is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.microsoft.com/exchange/services/2006/messages".
[In Namespaces] The prefix "wsdl" is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/ " and reference [WSDL].
[In Namespaces] The prefix "t" is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.microsoft.com/exchange/services/2006/types ".
[In Messages] This specification [MS-OXWSCORE] does not define any common WSDL message definitions.
[In Elements] The following table lists the set of common XML schema element [BaseItemId, ManagementRole] definitions that are defined by this specification [MS-OXWSCORE].
[In Elements] XML schema element [BaseItemId, ManagementRole] definitions that are specific to a particular operation are defined with the operation.
[In Elements] [The element "ManagementRole"] Specifies the roles the user or application wants to use.
[In t:ManagementRole Element] The ManagementRole element specifies the roles the user or application wants to use.<1> <xs:element name="ManagementRole" type="t:ManagementRoleType"/>

[In Complex Types] The following table lists the set of common XML schema complex type definitions [ArrayOfOccurrenceRangesType, FlagType, BaseMoveCopyItemType, SendItemResponseType, SendItemType, UpdateItemResponseMessageType, ConflictResultsType, ItemType, ManagementRoleType, MimeContentType, ,NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType, NonEmptyArrayOfInternetHeadersType, NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType, OccurrenceItemIdType, OccurrencesRangeType, RecurringMasterItemIdType, ItemIdType, ReferenceItemResponseType, SmartResponseBaseType, SmartResponseType, ArrayOfAddressesType, ArrayOfMeetingSuggestionsType, MeetingSuggestionType, ArrayOfTaskSuggestionsType, ArrayOfContactsType, ContactType, ArrayOfUrlsType, ArrayOfPhonesType, PhoneType, ArrayOfEmailUsersType, RightsManagementLicenseDataType] that are defined by this specification [MS-OXWSCORE].

[In Complex Types] XML schema complex type definitions [ArrayOfOccurrenceRangesType, FlagType, BaseMoveCopyItemType, SendItemResponseType, SendItemType, UpdateItemResponseMessageType, ConflictResultsType, ItemType, ManagementRoleType, MimeContentType, ,NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType, NonEmptyArrayOfInternetHeadersType, NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType, OccurrenceItemIdType, OccurrencesRangeType, RecurringMasterItemIdType, ItemIdType, ReferenceItemResponseType, SmartResponseBaseType, SmartResponseType, ArrayOfAddressesType, ArrayOfMeetingSuggestionsType, MeetingSuggestionType, ArrayOfTaskSuggestionsType, ArrayOfContactsType, ContactType, ArrayOfUrlsType, ArrayOfPhonesType, PhoneType, ArrayOfEmailUsersType, RightsManagementLicenseDataType] that are specific to a particular operation are defined with the operation.

[In Complex Types] [The complex type "ManagementRoleType"] Specifies the roles that are associated with a user or application.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ArrayOfOccurrenceRangesType Complex Type] The ArrayOfOccurrenceRangesType complex type specifies an array of occurrence ranges.<41> <xs:complexType name="ArrayOfOccurrenceRangesType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Range" type="t:OccurrencesRangeType" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:ArrayOfOccurrenceRangesType Complex Type] Range: An element of type OccurrencesRangeType, as defined in section 2.2.4.16, that represents a single occurrence range.

[In t:FlagType Complex Type] The FlagType complex type specifies a flag indicating status, start date, due date or completion date for an item.<51> <xs:complexType name="FlagType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="FlagStatus" type="t:FlagStatusType" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="StartDate" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="DueDate" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="CompleteDate" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1271.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:FlagType Complex Type] FlagStatus: An element of type FlagStatusType, as defined in [MS-OXWSCONV] section 3.1.4.1.4.2, that represents the flag status.
[In t:FlagType Complex Type] StartDate: An element of type dateTime, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.7, that represents the start date.
[In t:FlagType Complex Type] DueDate: An element of type dateTime that represents the due date.
[In t:FlagType Complex Type] CompleteDate: An element of type dateTime that represents the completion date.
[In t:FlagType Complex Type] If the FlagStatus element is set to Flagged, the CompleteDate element MUST not be set in the request, and the StartDate and DueDate elements MUST be set or unset in pair;
[In t:FlagType Complex Type] if the FlagStatus element is set to NotFlagged, the CompleteDate, StartDate, and DueDate elements MUST not be set in the request.
[In t:FlagType Complex Type] if the FlagStatus element is set to Complete, the StartDate and DueDate elements MUST not be set in the request;

[In t:FlagType Complex Type] Otherwise [If the FlagStatus element is set to Flagged, the CompleteDate element MUST not be set in the request, and the StartDate and DueDate elements MUST be set or unset in pair; if the FlagStatus element is set to Complete, the StartDate and DueDate elements MUST not be set in the request; if the FlagStatus element is set to NotFlagged, the CompleteDate, StartDate, and DueDate elements MUST not be set in the request.], ErrorInvalidArgument ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.

[In m:BaseMoveCopyItemType Complex Type] The BaseMoveCopyItemType complex type specifies the base type for the CopyItemType complex type, as specified in section 3.1.4.1.3.2, and the MoveItemType complex type, as specified in section 3.1.4.7.3.2.
[In m:BaseMoveCopyItemType Complex Type] The BaseMoveCopyItemType complex type extends the BaseRequestType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.15).

[In m:BaseMoveCopyItemType Complex Type] [The type BaseMoveCopyItemType is defined as follows:] <xs:complexType name="BaseMoveCopyItemType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="m:BaseRequestType" > <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ToFolderId" type="t:TargetFolderIdType" /> <xs:element name="ItemIds" type="t:NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType" /> <xs:element name="ReturnNewItemIds" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In m:BaseMoveCopyItemType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the child elements [ToFolderId, ItemIds, ReturnNewItemIds] of the BaseMoveCopyItemType complex type.
[In m:BaseMoveCopyItemType Complex Type] The type of ToFolderId is t:TargetFolderIdType ([MS-OXWSFOLD] section 2.2.4.14).

[In m:BaseMoveCopyItemType Complex Type] [The element "ToFolderId"] Specifies an instance of the TargetFolderIdType complex type that specifies the folder to which the items specified by the ItemIds property are to be moved.

[In m:BaseMoveCopyItemType Complex Type] [The element "ToFolderId"] Specifies an instance of the TargetFolderIdType complex type that specifies the folder to which the items specified by the ItemIds property are to be copied.
[In m:BaseMoveCopyItemType Complex Type] The type of ItemIds is t:NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType (section 2.2.4.11).
[In m:BaseMoveCopyItemType Complex Type] [The element "ItemIds"] Specifies an array of elements of type BaseItemIdType that specifies a set of items to be moved.
[In m:BaseMoveCopyItemType Complex Type] [The element "ItemIds"] Specifies an array of elements of type BaseItemIdType that specifies a set of items to be copied.
[In m:BaseMoveCopyItemType Complex Type] The type of ReturnNewItemIds is xs:boolean [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In m:BaseMoveCopyItemType Complex Type] [The element "ReturnNewItemIds"] Specifies a Boolean return value that indicates whether the ItemId element is to be returned for new items.
[In m:BaseMoveCopyItemType Complex Type] This element [The element "ReturnNewItemIds"] will be ignored by server. <45>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1230.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In m:SendItemResponseType Complex Type] The SendItemResponseType complex type specifies a response to a call to the SendItem operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.8.
[In m:SendItemResponseType Complex Type] The SendItemResponseType complex type extends the BaseResponseMessageType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.16).

[In m:SendItemResponseType Complex Type] [The type SendItemResponseType is defined as follows:] <xs:complexType name="SendItemResponseType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="m:BaseResponseMessageType" /> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In m:SendItemType Complex Type] The SendItemType complex type specifies a request to send a message.
[In m:SendItemType Complex Type] The SendItemType complex type extends the BaseRequestType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.15).

[In m:SendItemType Complex Type] [The type SendItemType is defined as follows:] <xs:complexType name="SendItemType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="m:BaseRequestType" > <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ItemIds" type="t:NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType" /> <xs:element name="SavedItemFolderId" type="t:TargetFolderIdType" minOccurs="0" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In m:SendItemType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the child elements [ItemIds,SavedItemFolderId] of the SendItemType complex type.
[In m:SendItemType Complex Type] The type of ItemIds is t:NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType (section 2.2.4.11).
[In m:SendItemType Complex Type] [The element "ItemIds"] Specifies an array of item identifiers for the items to try to send.
[In m:SendItemType Complex Type] The type of SavedItemFolderId is t:TargetFolderIdType ([MS-OXWSFOLD] section 2.2.4.14).
[In m:SendItemType Complex Type] [The element "SavedItemFolderId"] Specifies the identity of the folder that contains a saved version of a sent item.

[In m:UpdateItemResponseMessageType Complex Type] The UpdateItemResponseMessageType complex type specifies the status and result of a single call to the UpdateItem operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.9.
[In m:UpdateItemResponseMessageType Complex Type] The UpdateItemResponseMessageType complex type extends the ItemInfoResponseMessageType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.41).

[In m:UpdateItemResponseMessageType Complex Type] [The type UpdateItemResponseMessageType is defined as follow:] <xs:complexType name="UpdateItemResponseMessageType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="m:ItemInfoResponseMessageType" > <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ConflictResults" type="t:ConflictResultsType" minOccurs="0" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In m:UpdateItemResponseMessageType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the child elements [ConflictResults] of the UpdateItemResponseMessageType complex type.
[In m:UpdateItemResponseMessageType Complex Type] The type of ConflictResults is t:ConflictResultsType (section 2.2.4.7).
[In m:UpdateItemResponseMessageType Complex Type] [The element "ConflictResults"] Specifies the number of conflicts in the result of a single call.
[In t:ConflictResultsType Complex Type] The ConflictResultsType complex type specifies the number of conflicts in an UpdateItem operation response, as specified in section 3.1.4.9.

[In t:ConflictResultsType Complex Type] [The type ConflictResultsType is defined as follow:] <xs:complexType name="ConflictResultsType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Count" type="xs:int" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:ConflictResultsType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the child elements [Count] of the ConflictResultsType complex type.
[In t:ConflictResultsType Complex Type] The type of Count is xs:int [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In t:ConflictResultsType Complex Type] [The element "Count"] Specifies an integer value that indicates the number of conflicts in an UpdateItem operation response.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The ItemType complex type specifies a generic item on the server.

name="SortKey" type="xs:long" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="Hashtags" type="t:ArrayOfStringsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="Mentions" type="t:ArrayOfRecipientsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="MentionedMe" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="PendingSocialActivityTagIds" type="t:ArrayOfStringsType" minOccurs="0"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>

[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the child elements [MimeContent, ItemId, ParentFolderId, ItemClass, Subject, Sensitivity, Body, Attachments, DateTimeReceived, Size, Categories, Importance, InReplyTo, IsSubmitted, IsDraft, IsFromMe, IsResend, IsUnmodified, InternetMessageHeaders, DateTimeSent, DateTimeCreated, ResponseObjects, ReminderDueBy, ReminderIsSet, ReminderMinutesBeforeStart, ReminderNextTime, DisplayCc, DisplayTo, HasAttachments, ExtendedProperty, Culture, EffectiveRights, LastModifiedName, LastModifiedTime, IsAssociated, WebClientReadFormQueryString, WebClientEditFormQueryString, ConversationId, UniqueBody, Flag, StoreEntryId, InstanceKey, NormalizedBody, EntityExtractionResult, PolicyTag, ArchiveTag, RetentionDate, Preview, RightsManagementLicenseData, NextPredictedAction, GroupingAction, BlockStatus, HasBlockedImages, TextBody, IconIndex] of the ItemType complex type.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of MimeContent is t:MimeContentType (section 2.2.4.10).

[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "MimeContent"] Specifies an instance of the MimeContentType complex type that contains the native MIME stream of an object that is represented in base64encoding.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [MimeContent] is only applicable to PostItemType, MessageType, and CalendarItemType object when setting MIME content for an item.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] Or ErrorUnsupportedMimeConversion ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [MimeContent] is applicable for all item objects when retrieving MIME content.<52>.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R23091,MS-OXWSCORE_R23093

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of ItemId is t:ItemIdType (section 2.2.4.19).
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "ItemId"] Specifies an instance of the ItemIdType class that represents the unique identifier and change key of an item in the server data store.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [ItemId] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [ItemId] can be returned by the server.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] but if [ItemId] specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of ParentFolderId is t:FolderIdType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.35).
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "ParentFolderId"] Specifies an instance of the FolderIdType class that represents the identifier of the parent folder that contains an item or folder.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [ParentFolderId] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [ParentFolderId] may be returned by the server.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] but if [ParentFolderId] specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of ItemClass is t:ItemClassType (section 2.2.5.4).
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "ItemClass"] Specifies a string value that indicates the message class of an item.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This value is "IPM.Contact" for contact item.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This value is "IPM.Appointment" for calendar item.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This value is "IPM.Post" for post item.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This value is "IPM.Task" for task item.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This value is "IPM.DistList" for distribution list item.

[In t:ItemType Complex Type] If invalid values are set for these items in the CreateItem request, an ErrorObjectTypeChanged ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) response code will be returned in the CreateItem response.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of Subject is xs:string [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "Subject"] Specifies a string value that represents the subject property of items.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This value [Subject] is limited to 255 characters.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] If the calendar item is a room mailbox, the Subject element contains the organizer's name.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of Sensitivity is t:SensitivityChoicesType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.3.24).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXWSCORE_R1650, MS-OXWSCORE_R1651, MS-OXWSCORE_R1652, MS-OXWSCORE_R1653.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] The value "Confidential" of "Sensitivity" specifies the item as confidential.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The value "Normal" of "Sensitivity" specifies the item as normal.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The value "Personal" of "Sensitivity" specifies the item as personal.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The value "Private" of "Sensitivity" specifies the item as private.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "Sensitivity"] Specifies one of the valid SensitivityChoicesType simple type enumeration values that indicates the sensitivity level of an item.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of Body is t:BodyType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.17).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXWSCORE_R1679, MS-OXWSCORE_R1680.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] The value "HTML" of "Body" specifies the item body as HTML content.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The value "Text" of "Body" specifies the item body as text content.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "Body"] Specifies the body content of an item.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of Attachments is t:NonEmptyArrayOfAttachmentsType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.47).
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "Attachments"] Specifies an array of items or files that are attached to an item.<53>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R2281.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of DateTimeReceived is xs:dateTime [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "DateTimeReceived"] Specifies the date and time that an item was received in a mailbox.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [DateTimeReceived] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [DateTimeReceived] can be returned by the server.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] but if [DateTimeReceived] specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of Size is xs:int [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "Size"] Specifies an integer value that represents the size of an item, in bytes.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [Size] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [Size] can be returned by the server.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] but if [Size] specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of Categories is t:ArrayOfStringsType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.11).
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "Categories"] Specifies a string array that identifies the categories to which an item in a mailbox belongs.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of Importance is t:ImportanceChoicesType (section 2.2.5.3).
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "Importance"] Specifies one of the valid ImportanceChoicesType values to indicate the importance of an item.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of InReplyTo is xs:string.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "InReplyTo"] Specifies a string value that contains the identifier of the item to which this item is a reply.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of IsSubmitted is xs:boolean [XMLSCHEMA2].

[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "IsSubmitted"] Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether an item has been submitted to the folder which is used for submission. Such as Outbox folder or Drafts folder.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [IsSubmitted is] True, indicates an item has been submitted to the folder which is used for submission.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] otherwise [IsSubmitted is] false, indicates [an item has not been submitted to the folder].
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The folder which is used for submission] Such as Outbox folder or Drafts folder.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of IsDraft is xs:boolean.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "IsDraft"] Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether an item has been sent.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [IsDraft is] True, indicates an item has not been sent.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] otherwise [IsDraft is] false, indicates [an item has been sent].
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of IsFromMe is xs:boolean.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "IsFromMe"] Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether a user sent an item to himself or herself.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [IsFromMe is] True, indicates a user sent an item to himself or herself.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] otherwise [IsFromMe is] false, indicates [a user does not sent an item to himself or herself].
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of IsResend is xs:boolean.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "IsResend"] Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether an item has previously been sent.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [IsResend is] True, indicates an item has previously been sent.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] otherwise [IsResend is] false, indicates [an item has not previously been sent].
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of IsUnmodified is xs:boolean.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "IsUnmodified"] Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether an item has been modified.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [IsUnmodified is] True, indicates an item has not been modified.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] otherwise [IsUnmodified is] false, indicates [an item has been modified].
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of InternetMessageHeaders is t:NonEmptyArrayOfInternetHeadersType (section 2.2.4.12).

[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "InternetMessageHeaders"] Specifies an array of the type InternetHeaderType that represents the collection of all Internet message headers that are contained in an item in a mailbox.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] It [InternetMessageHeaders] can only be retrieved by GetItem (section 3.1.4.4) operation.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R20301.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] It [InternetMessageHeaders] can be retrieved by GetItem (section 3.1.4.4) operation.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of DateTimeSent is xs:dateTime.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "DateTimeSent"] Specifies the date and time when an item in a mailbox was sent.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [DateTimeSent] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [DateTimeSent] can be returned by the server.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] but if [DateTimeSent] specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of DateTimeCreated is xs:dateTime.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "DateTimeCreated"] Specifies the date and time when an item in a mailbox was created.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [DateTimeCreated] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [DateTimeCreated] can be returned by the server.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] but if [DateTimeCreated] specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of ResponseObjects is t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType (section 2.2.4.13).
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "ResponseObjects"] Specifies an array of type ResponseObjectType that contains a collection of all the response objects that are associated with an item.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of ReminderDueBy is xs:dateTime.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "ReminderDueBy"] Specifies an instance of the DateTime structure that represents the date and time when an event is to occur.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This [ReminderDueBy] is used by the ReminderMinutesBeforeStart element to determine when the reminder is displayed.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of ReminderIsSet is xs:boolean.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "ReminderIsSet"] Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether a reminder has been set for an item.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [ReminderIsSet is] True, indicates a reminder has been set for an item.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] otherwise [ReminderIsSet is] false, indicates [a reminder has not been set for an item].
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of ReminderNextTime is xs:dateTime.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "ReminderNextTime"] Specifies the date and time for the next reminder. <54>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R2283.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of ReminderMinutesBeforeStart is t:ReminderMinutesBeforeStartType (section 2.2.5.5).
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "ReminderMinutesBeforeStart"] Specifies an int value that indicates the number of minutes before an event occurs when a reminder is displayed.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of DisplayCc is xs:string.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "DisplayCc"] Specifies the display string that is used for the contents of the Cc box.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This [DisplayCc] is the concatenated string of all Cc recipient display names.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of DisplayTo is xs:string.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "DisplayTo"] Specifies the display string that is used for the contents of the To box.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This [DisplayTo] is the concatenated string of all To recipient display names.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [DisplayTo] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [DisplayTo] can be returned by the server.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] but if [DisplayTo] specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of HasAttachments is xs:boolean.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "HasAttachments"] Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether an item has at least one attachment.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [HasAttachments is] True, indicates an item has at least one attachment.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] otherwise [HasAttachments is] false, indicates [an item does not have at least one attachment].
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of ExtendedProperty is t:ExtendedPropertyType ([MS-OXWSXPROP] section 2.1.5).
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "ExtendedProperty"] Specifies an array of ExtendedPropertyType elements that identify extended MAPI properties.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of Culture is xs:language [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "Culture"] Specifies the culture for an item in a mailbox.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of EffectiveRights is t:EffectiveRightsType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.25).
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "EffectiveRights"] Specifies an EffectiveRightsType element that represents the client's rights based on the permission settings for an item.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "EffectiveRights" Specifies an EffectiveRightsType element that represents the client's rights based on the permission settings for] folder.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [EffectiveRights] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [EffectiveRights] can be returned by the server.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] but if [EffectiveRights] specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of LastModifiedName is xs:string.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "LastModifiedName"] Specifies a string value that contains the name of the user who last modified an item.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [LastModifiedName] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [LastModifiedName] can be returned by the server.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] but if [LastModifiedName] specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of LastModifiedTime is xs:dateTime.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "LastModifiedTime"] Specifies an instance of the DateTime structure that represents the date and time when an item was last modified.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of IsAssociated is xs:boolean.<55>
[In Appendix C: Product Behavior] Implementation does support the element IsAssociated with type xs:boolean. (Exchange Server 2010 and above follow this behavior.)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R13411.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Appendix C: Product Behavior] In Exchange Server 2007, Implementation does not support the element IsAssociated with type xs:boolean.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "IsAssociated"] Specifies a value that indicates whether the item is associated with a folder.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [IsAssociated is] True, indicates the item is associated with a folder.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] otherwise [IsAssociated is] false, indicates [the item is associated with a folder].
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of WebClientReadFormQueryString is xs:string.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "WebClientReadFormQueryString"] Specifies a query string that identifies a read form accessible by using a Web browser. <56>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R2338.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] It [WebClientReadFormQueryString] is read-only for client.

[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [WebClientReadFormQueryString] is read-only and may be returned by the server but if specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of WebClientEditFormQueryString is xs:string.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "WebClientEditFormQueryString"] MAY specify a query string that identifies an edit form accessible by using a Web browser<57>.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R2503.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] It [[WebClientEditFormQueryString] is read-only for client.UpdateItem.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of ConversationId is t:ItemIdType.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "ConversationId"] Specifies the ID of the conversation that an item is part of. <58>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R2288.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] The type of UniqueBody is t:BodyType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.17).
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The value "HTML" of "UniqueBody" specifies the item body as HTML content.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] The value "Text" of "UniqueBody" specifies the item body as text content.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "UniqueBody" ] Specifies the body part that is unique to the conversation that an item is part of.<59>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R2290.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "Flag" with type "t:FlagType"] Specifies a flag indicating status, start date, due date or completion date for an item .<60>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1346.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "StoreEntryId" with type "xs:base64Binary ([XMLSCHEMA2])"] Specifies the entry ID of the store that hosts an item. This element [StoreEntryId] SHOULD<61> be included.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] It [StoreEntryId] is read-only for the client and will be ignored by the server.<62>.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R20451,MS-OXWSCORE_R20452.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Appendix C: Product Behavior]It [StoreEntryId] is read-only for the client and will be ignored by the server.(<62> Section 2.2.4.24: In Exchange 2010 SP2, if the StoreEntryId is specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Appendix C: Product Behavior] It [StoreEntryId] is read-only for the client and will be ignored by the server.(<62> Section 2.2.4.24: In Exchange 2013 and above, if the StoreEntryId is specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, will be ignored by server.)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "InstanceKey" with type "xs:base64Binary"] Specifies the key for an instance.<63>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1348.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [InstanceKey] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type]but if [InstanceKey] specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [InstanceKey] can be returned by the server.

[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "NormalizedBody" with type "t:BodyType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.17)"] Specifies the version of the body of a message visible in the preview pane when accessing a message over the Internet.<64>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXWSCORE_R1349, MS-OXWSCORE_R1683.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [NormalizedBody] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] but if [NormalizedBody] specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [NormalizedBody] may be returned by the server.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "EntityExtractionResult" with type "t:EntityExtractionResultType (section 2.2.4.35)"] Specifies the result of an entity extraction .<65>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1350.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "PolicyTag" with type "t:RetentionTagType ([MS-OXWSURPT] section 2.2.4.1)"] Specifies the retention policy for the item.<66>
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "ArchiveTag" with type "t:RetentionTagType"] Specifies an archive tag.<67>
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "RetentionDate" with type "xs:dateTime"] Specifies the retention date for an item.<68>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1353.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "Preview" with type "xs:string"] Specifies the first 256 characters of the body of a message for preview without opening the message.<69>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1354.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [Preview] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] but if [Preview] specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [Preview] can be returned by the server.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "RightsManagementLicenseData" with type "t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType (section 2.2.4.37)"] Specifies rights management license data.<70>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1355.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [RightsManagementLicenseData] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] but if [RightsManagementLicenseData] specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [RightsManagementLicenseData] can be returned by the server.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "NextPredictedAction" with type "t:PredictedMessageActionType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.3.21)"] Specifies the next predicted action for the item.<71>
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "GroupingAction" with type "t:PredictedMessageActionType"] Specifies that the next predicted action is grouping items.<72>
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [GroupingAction] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [GroupingAction] can be returned by the server.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "PredictedActionReasons" with type "t:NonEmptyArrayOfPredictedActionReasonType"] intended for internal use only. <73>
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "IsClutter" with type "xs:boolean"] <71>intended for internal use only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "BlockStatus" with type "xs:boolean"] Indicates whether images are blocked.<75>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXWSCORE_R1357, MS-OXWSCORE_R1622.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [BlockStatus] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] but if [BlockStatus] specified in a CreateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [BlockStatus] can be returned by the server.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "HasBlockedImages" with type "xs:boolean"] Indicates whether the item has blocked images.<76>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXWSCORE_R1358, MS-OXWSCORE_R1623.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "TextBody" with type "t:BodyType"] Specifies the text body of the item.<77>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1731.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [TextBody] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] but if [TextBody] specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [TextBody] can be returned by the server .
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "IconIndex" with type "t:IconIndexType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.3.16)"] Specifies the index of the icon for the item.<78>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1917.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [IconIndex] is read-only.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] This element [IconIndex] can be returned by the server.
[In t:ItemType Complex Type] but if [IconIndex] specified in a CreateItem or UpdateItem request, an ErrorInvalidPropertySet ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.5.24) will be returned.

[In t:ItemType Complex Type] [The element "MimeContentUTF8" with type "t:MimeContentUTF8Type (section 2.2.4.29)"] Specifies an instance of the MimeContentUTF8Type complex type that contains the native MIME stream of an object that is represented in UTF-8.<79>

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ManagementRoleType Complex Type] The ManagementRoleType complex type specifies the roles that are associated with a user or application.<86> <xs:complexType name="ManagementRoleType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="UserRoles" type="t:NonEmptyArrayOfRoleType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="ApplicationRoles" type="t:NonEmptyArrayOfRoleType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>

[In t:ManagementRoleType Complex Type] The type of UserRoles is t:NonEmptyArrayOfRoleType (section 2.2.4.14).
[In t:ManagementRoleType Complex Type] [The element "UserRoles"] Specifies an array of elements of type string that specifies a set of user roles.
[In t:ManagementRoleType Complex Type] The type of ApplicationRoles is t:NonEmptyArrayOfRoleType(section 2.2.4.14).
[In t:ManagementRoleType Complex Type] [The element "ApplicationRoles"]Specifies an array of elements of type string that specifies a set of application roles.
[In t:MimeContentType Complex Type] The MimeContentType complex type specifies the native MIME stream of an object that is represented in base64 encoding.

[In t:MimeContentType Complex Type] [The attribute "CharacterSet"] Specifies the International Standards Organization (ISO) name of the character set that is used in a MIME message.

[In MimeContentUTF8Type Complex Type] [Tye type MimeContentUTF8Type is defined as follow:] <xs:complexType name="MimeContentUTF8Type"> <xs:simpleContent> <xs:extension base="xs:string"> <xs:attribute name="CharacterSet" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> </xs:extension> </xs:simpleContent> </xs:complexType>

[In MimeContentUTF8Type Complex Type] The type of CharacterSet is xs:string [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In MimeContentUTF8Type Complex Type] [The attribute "CharacterSet"] Specifies the character set used.
[In MimeContentUTF8Type Complex Type] This value [The attribute "CharacterSet"] is ignored by the server.

[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType Complex Type] The NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType complex type specifies a collection of items.

[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType Complex Type] [The type NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType is defined as follow:] <xs:complexType name="NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType"> <xs:choice minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded" > <xs:element name="ItemId" type="t:ItemIdType" /> <xs:element name="OccurrenceItemId" type="t:OccurrenceItemIdType" /> <xs:element name="RecurringMasterItemId" type="t:RecurringMasterItemIdType" /> </xs:choice> </xs:complexType>

[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the child elements [ItemId, OccurrenceItemId, RecurringMasterItemId, RecurringMasterItemIdRanges] of the NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType complex type.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType Complex Type] The type of ItemId is t:ItemIdType (section 2.2.4.19).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType Complex Type] [The element "ItemId"] Specifies the item identifier.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType Complex Type] The type of OccurrenceItemId is t:OccurrenceItemIdType (section 2.2.4.15).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType Complex Type] [The element "OccurrenceItemId] Specifies a single occurrence of a recurring item.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType Complex Type] The type of RecurringMasterItemId is t:RecurringMasterItemIdType (section 2.2.4.17).

[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType Complex Type] [The element "RecurringMasterItemId"] Specifies a recurrence master item by indicating the identifier of one of the master item's related occurrence items.

[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType Complex Type] [The element "RecurringMasterItemIdRanges" with type "RecurringMasterItemIdRangesType (section 2.2.4.18)"] Specifies a union of all occurrences of a recurring master, which fit into at least one of the specified ranges.<91>
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfInternetHeadersType Complex Type] The NonEmptyArrayOfInternetHeadersType complex type specifies the collection of all Internet message headers that are contained in an item.

[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfInternetHeadersType Complex Type] The type [NonEmptyArrayOfInternetHeadersType] is defined as follow: <xs:complexType name="NonEmptyArrayOfInternetHeadersType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="InternetMessageHeader" type="t:InternetHeaderType" maxOccurs="unbounded" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfInternetHeadersType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the child elements [InternetMessageHeader] of the NonEmptyArrayOfInternetHeadersType complex type.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfInternetHeadersType Complex Type] The type of InternetMessageHeader is t:InternetHeaderType([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.35).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfInternetHeadersType Complex Type] [The element "InternetMessageHeader"] Specifies a single Internet message header.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] The NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType complex type specifies an array of response objects.

[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] [The type NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType is defined as follow:] <xs:complexType name="NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType"> <xs:choice maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" > <xs:element name="AcceptItem" type="t:AcceptItemType" /> <xs:element name="TentativelyAcceptItem" type="t:TentativelyAcceptItemType" /> <xs:element name="DeclineItem" type="t:DeclineItemType" /> <xs:element name="ReplyToItem" type="t:ReplyToItemType" /> <xs:element name="ForwardItem" type="t:ForwardItemType" /> <xs:element name="ReplyAllToItem" type="t:ReplyAllToItemType" /> <xs:element name="CancelCalendarItem" type="t:CancelCalendarItemType" /> <xs:element name="RemoveItem" type="t:RemoveItemType" /> <xs:element name="SuppressReadReceipt" type="t:SuppressReadReceiptType" /> <xs:element name="PostReplyItem" type="t:PostReplyItemType" /> <xs:element name="AcceptSharingInvitation" type="t:AcceptSharingInvitationType" /> <xs:element name="AddItemToMyCalendar" type="t:AddItemToMyCalendarType" /> <xs:element name="ProposeNewTime" type="t:ProposeNewTimeType" /> </xs:choice> </xs:complexType>

[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the child elements [AcceptItem, TentativelyAcceptItem, DeclineItem, ReplyToItem, ForwardItem, ReplyAllToItem, CancelCalendarItem, RemoveItem, SuppressReadReceipt, PostReplyItem, AcceptSharingInvitation] of the NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType complex type.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] The type of AcceptItem is type t:AcceptItemType([MS-OXWSMTGS] section 2.2.4.1).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] [The element "AcceptItem"] Specifies an Accept reply to a meeting request.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] The type of TentativelyAcceptItem is t:TentativelyAcceptItemType([MS-OXWSMTGS] section 2.2.4.27).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] [The element "TentativelyAcceptItem"] Specifies a Tentative reply to a meeting request.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] The type of DeclineItem is t:DeclineItemType ([MS-OXWSMTGS] section 2.2.4.11).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] [The element "DeclineItem"] Specifies a Decline reply to a meeting request.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] The type of ReplyToItem is t:ReplyToItemType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.64).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] [The element "ReplyToItem"] Specifies a reply to the sender of an item.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] The type of ForwardItem is t:ForwardItemType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.37).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] [The element "ForwardItem"] Specifies a server store item to be forwarded to recipients.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] The type of ReplyAllToItem is t:ReplyAllToItemType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.62).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] [The element "ReplyAllToItem"] Specifies a reply to the sender and all identified recipients of an item in the server store.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] The type of CancelCalendarItem is t:CancelCalendarItemType ([MS-OXWSMTGS] section 2.2.4.10).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] [The element "CancelCalendarItem"] Specifies the response object that is used to cancel a meeting.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] The type of RemoveItem is t:RemoveItemType ([MS-OXWSMTGS] section 2.2.4.26).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] [The element "RemoveItem"] Specifies a response object that is used to remove a meeting item when a MeetingCancellation message is received.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] The type of SuppressReadReceipt is t:SuppressReadReceiptType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.71).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] [The element "SuppressReadReceipt"] Specifies that read receipts are to be suppressed.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] The type of PostReplyItem is t:PostReplyItemType ([MS-OXWSPOST] section 2.2.4.3).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] [The element "PostReplyItem"] Specifies a reply to a post item.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] The type of AcceptSharingInvitation is t:AcceptSharingInvitationType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.3).

[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] [The element "AcceptSharingInvitation"] Specifies a response object that is used to accept an invitation that allows access to another user's calendar or contacts data.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] The type of AddItemToMyCalendar is t:AddItemToMyCalendarType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.2).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] [The element "AddItemToMyCalendar"] Specifies the response object that is used to add an item to the user's calendar.<92>
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] The type of ProposeNewTime is t:ProposeNewTimeType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.38).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfResponseObjectsType Complex Type] [The element "ProposeNewTime"] Specifies the response object that is used to propose a new time.<93>
