ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:NonEmptyArrayOfRoleType Complex Type] The NonEmptyArrayOfRoleType complex type specifies an array of role types.<94> <xs:complexType name="NonEmptyArrayOfRoleType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Role" type="xs:string" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfRoleType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the child elements [Role] of the NonEmptyArrayOfRoleType complex type.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfRoleType Complex Type] The type of Role is xs:string [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfRoleType Complex Type] [The element "Role"] Specifies the name of a role.
[In t:OccurrenceItemIdType Complex Type] The OccurrenceItemIdType complex type specifies a single occurrence of a recurring item.
[In t:OccurrenceItemIdType Complex Type] The OccurrenceItemIdType complex type extends the BaseItemIdType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.13).

[In t:OccurrenceItemIdType Complex Type] [The type t:OccurrenceItemIdType is defined as follow:] <xs:complexType name="OccurrenceItemIdType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:BaseItemIdType" > <xs:attribute name="RecurringMasterId" type="t:DerivedItemIdType" use="required" /> <xs:attribute name="ChangeKey" type="xs:string" use="optional" /> <xs:attribute name="InstanceIndex" type="xs:int" use="required" /> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:OccurrenceItemIdType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the attributes [ReccurringMasterId, ChangeKey, InstanceIndex] of the OccurrenceItemIdType complex type.
[In t:OccurrenceItemIdType Complex Type] The type of RecurringMasterId is t:DerivedItemIdType (section 2.2.5.1).
[In t:OccurrenceItemIdType Complex Type] [The attribute "RecurringMasterId"] Specifies the identifier of the recurring master of a recurring item.
[In t:OccurrenceItemIdType Complex Type] The type of ChangeKey is xs:string [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In t:OccurrenceItemIdType Complex Type] [The attribute "ChangeKey"] Specifies a specific version of a single occurrence of a recurring master item.
[In t:OccurrenceItemIdType Complex Type] The type of InstanceIndex is xs:int [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In t:OccurrenceItemIdType Complex Type] [The attribute "InstanceIndex"] Specifies the index of an item occurrence.

[In t:OccurrencesRangeType Complex Type] The OccurrencesRangeType complex type specifies a range of occurrences.<95> <xs:complexType name="OccurrencesRangeType"> <xs:attribute name="Start" type="xs:dateTime" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="End" type="xs:dateTime" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="Count" type="xs:int" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="CompareOriginalStartTime" type="xs:boolean" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType>
[In t:OccurrencesRangeType Complex Type] Start: An attribute of type dateTime, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.7, that represents the start of the range.
[In t:OccurrencesRangeType Complex Type] End: An attribute of type dateTime that represents the end of the range.
[In t:OccurrencesRangeType Complex Type] Count: An attribute of type integer, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.3.13, that represents the number of occurrences.
[In t:OccurrencesRangeType Complex Type] Count: The default value is 1.

[In t:OccurrencesRangeType Complex Type] CompareOriginalStartTime: An attribute of type boolean, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.2, that indicates whether to compare the specified ranges to either an original start time or a pair of start and end values.
[In t:OccurrencesRangeType Complex Type] [CompareOriginalStartTime is] True, indicates comparing the specified ranges to an original start time.
[In t:OccurrencesRangeType Complex Type] otherwise [CompareOriginalStartTime is] false, indicates comparing the specified ranges to a pair of start and end values.
[In t:OccurrencesRangeType Complex Type] [CompareOriginalStartTime:] The default value of the CompareOriginalStartTime attribute is "false".

[In t:RecurringMasterItemIdType Complex Type] The RecurringMasterItemIdType complex type specifies a recurrence master item by indicating the identifiers of one of the master item's related occurrence items.
[In t:RecurringMasterItemIdType Complex Type] The RecurringMasterItemIdType complex type extends the BaseItemIdType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.13).

[In t:RecurringMasterItemIdType Complex Type] [The type RecurringMasterItemIdType is defined as follow:] <xs:complexType name="RecurringMasterItemIdType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:BaseItemIdType" > <xs:attribute name="OccurrenceId" type="t:DerivedItemIdType" use="required" /> <xs:attribute name="ChangeKey" type="xs:string" use="optional" /> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:RecurringMasterItemIdType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the attributes [OccurrenceId, ChangeKey] of the RecurringMasterItemIdType complex type.
[In t:RecurringMasterItemIdType Complex Type] The type of OccurrenceId is t:DerivedItemIdType (section 2.2.5.1).
[In t:RecurringMasterItemIdType Complex Type] [The attribute "OccurrenceId"]Specifies a single occurrence of a recurring master item.
[In t:RecurringMasterItemIdType Complex Type] The type of ChangeKey is xs:string [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In t:RecurringMasterItemIdType Complex Type] [The attribute "ChangeKey"] Specifies a specific version of a single occurrence of a recurring master item.

[In t:RecurringMasterItemIdRangesType Complex Type] The RecurringMasterItemIdRangesType complex type specifies a union of all occurrences of a recurring master item, which fit into at least one of the specified ranges.
[In t:RecurringMasterItemIdRangesType Complex Type] This type [RecurringMasterItemIdRangesType] extends the ItemIdType complex type, as specified by section 2.2.4.25.<98>

[In t:RecurringMasterItemIdRangesType Complex Type] [The type RecurringMasterItemIdRangesType is defined as follow:] <xs:complexType name="RecurringMasterItemIdRangesType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:ItemIdType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Ranges" type="t:ArrayOfOccurrenceRangesType" minOccurs="0"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:RecurringMasterItemIdRangesType Complex Type] The following table describes the child element [Ranges]of the RecurringMasterItemIdRangesType complex type.
[In t:RecurringMasterItemIdRangesType Complex Type] The type of Ranges is t:ArrayOfOccurrenceRangesType (section 2.2.4.1).
[In t:RecurringMasterItemIdRangesType Complex Type] [The element "Ranges"] Specifies an array of occurrence ranges.
[In t:ItemIdType Complex Type] The ItemIdType complex type specifies an item identifier of an item.
[In t:ItemIdType Complex Type] The ItemIdType complex type extends the BaseItemIdType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.13).

[In t:ItemIdType Complex Type] [The type ItemIdType is defined as follow:] <xs:complexType name="ItemIdType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:BaseItemIdType" > <xs:attribute name="Id" type="xs:string" use="required" /> <xs:attribute name="ChangeKey" type="xs:string" use="optional" /> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:ItemIdType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the attributes [Id, ChangeKey] of the ItemIdType complex type.
[In t:ItemIdType Complex Type] The type of Id is xs:string [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In t:ItemIdType Complex Type] [The attribute "Id"] Specifies an item identifier.
[In t:ItemIdType Complex Type] The maximum size of this attribute [Id] is 512 bytes after base64 encoding.
[In t:ItemIdType Complex Type] The type of ChangeKey is xs:string.
[In t:ItemIdType Complex Type] [The attribute "ChangeKey"] Specifies a change key.
[In t:ItemIdType Complex Type] The maximum size of this attribute [ChangeKey] is 512 bytes after base64 encoding.
[In t:ReferenceItemResponseType Complex Type] The ReferenceItemResponseType complex type specifies a referenced item for a response object.
[In t:ReferenceItemResponseType Complex Type] The ReferenceItemResponseType complex type extends the ResponseObjectType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.67).

[In t:ReferenceItemResponseType Complex Type] The type [ReferenceItemResponseType] is define as follow: <xs:complexType name="ReferenceItemResponseType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:restriction base="t:ResponseObjectType" > <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ReferenceItemId" type="t:ItemIdType" minOccurs="0" /> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="ObjectName" type="xs:string" use="prohibited" /> </xs:restriction> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:ReferenceItemResponseType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the child elements [ReferenceItemId, ObjectName] of the ReferenceItemResponseType complex type.
[In t:ReferenceItemResponseType Complex Type] The type of ReferenceItemId is t:ItemIdType (section 2.2.4.19).
[In t:ReferenceItemResponseType Complex Type] [The element "ReferenceItemId" ] Specifies the referenced item identifier.
[In t:ReferenceItemResponseType Complex Type] The type of ObjectName is xs:string [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In t:ReferenceItemResponseType Complex Type] [The element "ObjectName"] Specifies the name of the reply object class as a string.

[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The SmartResponseBaseType complex type specifies the base type for the ReplyToItemType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.64), the ReplyAllToItemType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.62), the ForwardItemType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.37), and the CancelCalendarItemType complex type, as specified in [MS-OXWSMTGS] section 2.2.4.10.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The SmartResponseBaseType complex type extends the ResponseObjectType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.67).

[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] [The type SmartResponseBaseType is defined as follow:] <xs:complexType name="SmartResponseBaseType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:restriction base="t:ResponseObjectType" > <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Subject" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="Body" type="t:BodyType" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="ToRecipients" type="t:ArrayOfRecipientsType" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="CcRecipients" type="t:ArrayOfRecipientsType" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="BccRecipients" type="t:ArrayOfRecipientsType" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="IsReadReceiptRequested" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="IsDeliveryReceiptRequested" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="From" type="t:SingleRecipientType" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="ReferenceItemId" type="t:ItemIdType" minOccurs="0" /> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="ObjectName" type="xs:string" use="prohibited" /> </xs:restriction> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>

[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the child elements [Subject, Body, ToRecipients, CcRecipients, BccRecipients, IsReadReceiptRequested, IsDeliveryReceiptRequested, From, ReferenceItemId] of the SmartResponseBaseType complex type.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The type of Subject is xs:string [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] [The element "Subject"] Specifies the subject.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The type of Body is t:BodyType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.17).
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] [The element "Body"] Specifies the body content of an item.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The type of ToRecipients is t:ArrayOfRecipientsType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.9).
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] [The element "ToRecipients"] Specifies a collection of recipients of an email message.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] This property [ToRecipients] is required for sending a message.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The type of CcRecipients is t:ArrayOfRecipientsType.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] [The element "CcRecipients"] Specifies a collection of carbon copy (Cc) recipients of an email message.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The type of BccRecipients is t:ArrayOfRecipientsType.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] [The element "BccRecipients"] Specifies a collection of blind carbon copy (Bcc) recipients of an email message.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The type of IsReadReceiptRequested is xs:boolean [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] [The element "IsReadReceiptRequested"] Specifies whether a read receipt is requested.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] [IsReadReceiptRequested is] True, specifies a read receipt is requested.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] otherwise [IsReadReceiptRequested is] false, specifies [a read receipt is not requested].
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The type of IsDeliveryReceiptRequested is xs:boolean.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] [The element "IsDeliveryReceiptRequested"] Specifies whether a delivery receipt is requested.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] [IsDeliveryReceiptRequested is] True, specifies a delivery receipt is requested.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] otherwise [IsDeliveryReceiptRequested is] false, specifies [a delivery receipt is not requested].
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The type of From is t:SingleRecipientType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.69).
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The value Unknown in From which specifies an unknown type of mailbox.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The value OneOff in From which specifies a one-off member of a personal distribution list.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The value Contact in From which specifies contact in a user's mailbox.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The value Mailbox in From which specifies a mail-enabled directory service object.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The value PrivatieDL in From which specifies a private distribution list in a user's mailbox.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The value PublicDL in From which specifies a public distribution list.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The value PublicFolder in From which specifies a public folder.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] [The element "From"] Specifies the addressee from whom a message was sent.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The type of ReferenceItemId is t:ItemIdType (section 2.2.4.19).
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] [The element "ReferenceItemId"] Specifies the item identifier that is related to a response object.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the attributes [ObjectName] of the SmartResponseBaseType complex type.
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] The type of ObjectName is xs:string [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In t:SmartResponseBaseType Complex Type] [The attribute "ObjectName"] Specifies the name of the reply object class as an English-language string.

[In t:SmartResponseType Complex Type] The SmartResponseType complex type specifies the base type for the ReplyToItemType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.64), the ReplyAllToItemType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.62), the ForwardItemType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.37), and the CancelCalendarItemType complex type, as specified in [MS-OXWSMTGS] section 2.2.4.10.
[In t:SmartResponseType Complex Type] The SmartResponseType complex type extends the SmartResponseBaseType complex type, as specified in section 2.2.4.21.

[In t:SmartResponseType Complex Type] [The type SmartResponseType is defined as follow:] <xs:complexType name="SmartResponseType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:SmartResponseBaseType" > <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="NewBodyContent" type="t:BodyType" minOccurs="0" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:SmartResponseType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the child elements [NewBodyContent] of the SmartResponseType complex type.
[In t:SmartResponseType Complex Type] The type of NewBodyContent is t:BodyType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.17).
[In t:SmartResponseType Complex Type] [The element "NewBodyContent"] Specifies the new body content of a message response object.

[In t:ArrayOfAddressesType Complex Type] The ArrayOfAddressesType complex type specifies an array of addresses.<32> <xs:complexType name="ArrayOfAddressesType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Address" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1272.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ArrayOfAddressesType Complex Type] Address: An element of type string, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.1, that represents a single address.

[In t:ArrayOfMeetingSuggestionsType Complex Type] The ArrayOfMeetingSuggestionsType complex type specifies an array of meeting suggestions.<38> <xs:complexType name="ArrayOfMeetingSuggestionsType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="MeetingSuggestion" type="t:MeetingSuggestionType" maxOccurs="unbounded" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1275.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ArrayOfMeetingSuggestionsType Complex Type] MeetingSuggestion: An element of type MeetingSuggestionType, as defined in section 2.2.4.25, that represents a single meeting suggestion.

[In t:MeetingSuggestionType Complex Type] The MeetingSuggestionType complex type specifies a meeting suggestion.<87> <xs:complexType name="MeetingSuggestionType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Attendees" type="t:ArrayOfEmailUsersType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" /> <xs:element name="Location" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="Subject" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="MeetingString" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="StartTime" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="EndTime" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1276.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:MeetingSuggestionType Complex Type] Attendees: An element of type ArrayOfEmailUsersType, as defined in section 2.2.4.32, that represents those invited to the meeting.
[In t:MeetingSuggestionType Complex Type] Location: An element of type string, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.1, that represents the location of the meeting.<88>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R2935,MS-OXWSCORE_R2936.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:MeetingSuggestionType Complex Type] Subject: An element of type string that represents the subject of the meeting.
[In t:MeetingSuggestionType Complex Type] MeetingString: An element of type string that represents the name of the meeting.
[In t:MeetingSuggestionType Complex Type] StartTime: An element of type dateTime, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.7, that represents the start time of the meeting.
[In t:MeetingSuggestionType Complex Type] EndTime: An element of type dateTime that represents the ending time of the meeting.

[In t:ArrayOfTaskSuggestionsType Complex Type] The ArrayOfTaskSuggestionsType complex type specifies an array of task suggestions.<42> <xs:complexType name="ArrayOfTaskSuggestionsType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="TaskSuggestion" type="t:TaskSuggestionType" maxOccurs="unbounded" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1277.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ArrayOfTaskSuggestionsType Complex Type] TaskSuggestion: An element of type TaskSuggestionType, as defined in section 2.2.4.34, that represents a single task suggestion.

[In t:ArrayOfContactsType Complex Type] The ArrayOfContactsType complex type specifies an array of contacts.<33> <xs:complexType name="ArrayOfContactsType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Contact" type="t:ContactType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1278.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ArrayOfContactsType Complex Type] Contact: An element of type ContactType, as defined in section 2.2.4.28, that represents a single contact.

[In t:ContactType Complex Type] The ContactType complex type specifies the type of a contact.<46> <xs:complexType name="ContactType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="PersonName" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="BusinessName" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="PhoneNumbers" type="t:ArrayOfPhonesType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" /> <xs:element name="Urls" type="t:ArrayOfUrlsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" /> <xs:element name="EmailAddresses" type="t:ArrayOfExtractedEmailAddresses" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" /> <xs:element name="Addresses" type="t:ArrayOfAddressesType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" /> <xs:element name="ContactString" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1279.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ContactType Complex Type] PersonName: An element of type string, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] 3.2.1, that represents the name of a person.
[In t:ContactType Complex Type] BusinessName: An element of type string that represents the name of a business.
[In t:ContactType Complex Type] PhoneNumbers: An element of type ArrayOfPhonesType, as defined in section 2.2.4.30, that represents phone number contacts.
[In t:ContactType Complex Type] Urls: An element of type ArrayOfUrlsType, as defined in section 2.2.4.29, that represents URL contacts.
[In t:ContactType Complex Type] EmailAddresses: An element of type ArrayOfExtractedEmailAddresses, as defined in section 2.2.4.35, that represents email contacts.
[In t:ContactType Complex Type] Addresses: An element of type ArrayOfAddressesType, as defined in section 2.2.4.23, that represents postal addresses of contacts.
[In t:ContactType Complex Type] ContactString: An element of type string that represents the display name of a contact.

[In t:ArrayOfUrlsType Complex Type] The ArrayOfUrlsType complex type specifies an array of URLs.<44> <xs:complexType name="ArrayOfUrlsType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Url" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1280.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ArrayOfUrlsType Complex Type] Url: An element of type string, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.1, that specifies a single URL.

[In t:ArrayOfPhonesType Complex Type] The ArrayOfPhonesType complex type specifies an array of phone numbers.<40> <xs:complexType name="ArrayOfPhonesType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Phone" type="t:PhoneType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1281.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ArrayOfPhonesType Complex Type] Phone: An element of type PhoneType, as defined in section 2.2.4.31, that represents a single phone number.

[In t:PhoneType Complex Type] The PhoneType complex type specifies a phone number and its type.<96> <xs:complexType name="PhoneType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="OriginalPhoneString" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="PhoneString" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="Type" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1282.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:PhoneType Complex Type] OriginalPhoneString: An element of type string, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.1, that represents the original phone number.
[In t:PhoneType Complex Type] PhoneString: An element of type string that represents the current phone number.
[In t:PhoneType Complex Type] Type: An element of type string that represents the type of phone, for example, "Business" or "Home".

[In t:ArrayOfEmailUsersType Complex Type] The ArrayOfEmailUsersType complex type specifies an array of email users.<35> <xs:complexType name="ArrayOfEmailUsersType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="EmailUser" type="t:EmailUserType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1283.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ArrayOfEmailUsersType Complex Type] EmailUser: An element of type EmailUserType, as defined in section 2.2.4.33, that represents a single email user.

[In t:EmailUserType Complex Type] The EmailUserType complex type specifies an email user.<48> <xs:complexType name="EmailUserType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Name" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="UserId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1284.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:EmailUserType Complex Type] Name: An element of type string, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.1, that represents the name of the email user.
[In t:EmailUserType Complex Type] UserId: An element of type string that represents the user identifier of the email user.

[In t:TaskSuggestionType Complex Type] The TaskSuggestionType complex type specifies a task suggestion.<101> <xs:complexType name="TaskSuggestionType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="TaskString" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="Assignees" type="t:EmailUserType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1286.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:TaskSuggestionType Complex Type] TaskString: An element of type string, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.1, that represents the name of the task.
[In t:TaskSuggestionType Complex Type] Assignees: An element of type ArrayOfEmailUsersType, as defined in section 2.2.4.31, that represents the persons that are to accomplish the task.

[In t:ArrayOfExtractedEmailAddresses Complex Type] The ArrayOfExtractedEmailAddress complex type specifies an array of email addresses.<36> <xs:complexType name="ArrayOfExtractedEmailAddresses"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="EmailAddress" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1287.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:ArrayOfExtractedEmailAddresses Complex Type] EmailAddress: An element of type string, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.1, that represents a single email address.

[In t:ArrayOfItemIdsType Complex Type] The ArrayOfItemIdsType complex type specifies an array of item ids.<37> <xs:complexType name="ArrayOfItemIdsType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ItemId" type="t:ItemIdType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:ArrayOfItemIdsType Complex Type] The following table lists the child element [ItemId] of the ArrayOfItemIdsType complex type.
[In t:ArrayOfItemIdsType Complex Type] The type of ItemId is t:ItemIdType (section 2.2.4.25).
[In t:ArrayOfItemIdsType Complex Type] [The element "ItemId"] describes The identifier of an item.

[In t:EntityExtractionResultType Complex Type] The EntityExtractionResultType complex type specifies the result of an entity extraction.<49> <xs:complexType name="EntityExtractionResultType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Addresses" type="t:ArrayOfAddressEntitiesType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" /> <xs:element name="MeetingSuggestions" type="t:ArrayOfMeetingSuggestionsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" /> <xs:element name="TaskSuggestions" type="t:ArrayOfTaskSuggestionsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" /> <xs:element name="EmailAddresses" type="t:ArrayOfEmailAddressEntitiesType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" /> <xs:element name="Contacts" type="t:ArrayOfContactsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" /> <xs:element name="Urls" type="t:ArrayOfUrlEntitiesType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" /> <xs:element name="PhoneNumbers" type="t:ArrayOfPhoneEntitiesType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1288.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:EntityExtractionResultType Complex Type] Addresses: An element of type ArrayOfAddressEntitiesType, as defined in section 2.2.4.2, that represents the address entities returned.
[In t:EntityExtractionResultType Complex Type] MeetingSuggestions: An element of type ArrayOfMeetingSuggestionsType, as defined in section 2.2.4.24, that represents the meeting suggestions returned.
[In t:EntityExtractionResultType Complex Type] TaskSuggestions: An element of type ArrayOfTaskSuggestionsType, as defined in section 2.2.4.26, that represents the task suggestions returned.
[In t:EntityExtractionResultType Complex Type] EmailAddresses: An element of type ArrayOfEmailAddressEntitiesType, as defined in section 2.2.4.35, that represents the email addresses returned.
[In t:EntityExtractionResultType Complex Type] Contacts: An element of type ArrayOfContactsType, as defined in section 2.2.4.27, that represents the contacts returned.
[In t:EntityExtractionResultType Complex Type] Urls: An element of type ArrayOfUrlEntitiesType, as defined in section 2.2.4.29, that represents the URLs returned.
[In t:EntityExtractionResultType Complex Type] PhoneNumbers: An element of type ArrayOfPhoneEntitiesType, as defined in section 2.2.4.30, that represents the phone numbers returned.

[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] The RightsManagementLicenseDataType complex type specifies information about the rights management license.<99> <xs:complexType name="RightsManagementLicenseDataType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="RightsManagedMessageDecryptionStatus" type="xs:int" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="RmsTemplateId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="TemplateName" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="TemplateDescription" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="EditAllowed" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="ReplyAllowed" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="ReplyAllAllowed" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="ForwardAllowed" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="ModifyRecipientsAllowed" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="ExtractAllowed" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="PrintAllowed" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="ExportAllowed" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="ProgrammaticAccessAllowed" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="IsOwner" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="ContentOwner" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="ContentExpiryDate" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] RightsManagedMessageDecryptionStatus: An element of type int, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2], that specifies the decryption status of the message.

[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] RmsTemplateId: An element of type string, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.1, that specifies the identifier of the Rights Management template.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] TemplateName: An element of type string that specifies the name of the Rights Management template.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] TemplateDescription: An element of type string that specifies the description of the Rights Management template.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] EditAllowed: An element of type boolean, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.2, that indicates whether the information is editable.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] [EditAllowed is] True, indicates the information is editable.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] otherwise [EditAllowed is] false, indicates [the information is not editable].
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] ReplyAllowed: An element of type boolean that indicates whether replying is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] [ReplyAllowed is] True, indicates replying is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] otherwise [ReplyAllowed is] false, indicates [replying is not enabled].
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] ReplyAllAllowed: An element of type boolean that indicates whether replying to all recipients is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] [ReplyAllAllowed is] True, indicates replying to all recipients is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] otherwise [ReplyAllAllowed is] false, indicates [replying to all recipients is not enabled].
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] ForwardAllowed: An element of type boolean that indicates whether forwarding is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] [ForwardAllowed is] True, indicates forwarding is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] otherwise [ForwardAllowed is] false, indicates [forwarding is not enabled].
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] ModifyRecipientsAllowed: An element of type boolean that indicates whether modifying the list of recipients is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] [ModifyRecipientsAllowed is] True, indicates modifying the list of recipients is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] otherwise [ModifyRecipientsAllowed is] false, indicates [modifying the list of recipients is not enabled].
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] ExtractAllowed: An element of type boolean that indicates whether extracting is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] [ExtractAllowed is] True, indicates extracting is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] otherwise [ExtractAllowed is] false, indicates [extracting is not enabled].
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] PrintAllowed: An element of type boolean that indicates whether printing is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] [PrintAllowed is] True, indicates printing is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] otherwise [PrintAllowed is] false, indicates [printing is not enabled].
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] ExportAllowed: An element of type boolean that indicates whether exporting is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] [ExportAllowed is] True, indicates exporting is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] otherwise [ExportAllowed is] false, indicates [exporting is not enabled].
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] ProgrammaticAccessAllowed: An element of type boolean that indicates whether programmatic access is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] [ProgrammaticAccessAllowed is] True, indicates programmatic access is enabled.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] otherwise [ProgrammaticAccessAllowed is] false, indicates [programmatic access is not enabled].
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] IsOwner: An element of type boolean that indicates whether a user is the owner.
[In t:RightsManagementLicenseDataType Complex Type] [IsOwner is] True, indicates a user is the owner.

[In Simple Types] The following table lists the set of common XML schema simple type [DerivedItemIdType, EmailPositionType, ImportanceChoicesType, ItemClassType, ReminderMinutesBeforeStartType] definitions that are defined by this specification [MS-OXWSCORE].

[In Simple Types] XML schema simple type [DerivedItemIdType, EmailPositionType, ImportanceChoicesType, ItemClassType, ReminderMinutesBeforeStartType] definitions that are specific to a particular operation are defined with the operation.
[In Simple Types] [The simple type "DerivedItemIdType"] Specifies the identifier of the recurring master of a recurring item.
[In Simple Types] [The simple type "EmailPositionType"] Specifies a position in an email item.
[In Simple Types] [The simple type "ImportanceChoicesType"] Specifies the levels of importance for an item.
[In Simple Types] [The simple type "ItemClassType"] Specifies an item class.
[In Simple Types] [The simple type "ReminderMinutesBeforeStartType"] Specifies the number of minutes before an event occurs when a reminder is displayed.
[In t:DerivedItemIdType Simple Type] The DerivedItemIdType simple type specifies the identifier of the recurring master of a recurring item.
[In t:DerivedItemIdType Simple Type] [The type DerivedItemIdType is defined as follow:] <xs:simpleType name="DerivedItemIdType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string" /> </xs:simpleType>
[In t:EmailPositionType Simple Type] The EmailPositionType simple type specifies where an entity was found in a message.

[In t:EmailPositionType Simple Type] [The type EmailPositionType is defined as follow:] xs:simpleType name="EmailPositionType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="LatestReply"/> <xs:enumeration value="Other"/> <xs:enumeration value="Subject"/> <xs:enumeration value="Signature"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType>
[In t:EmailPositionType Simple Type]The following table lists and describes the values [LatestReply, Other, Subject, Signature] defined by the EmailPositionType simple type.
[In t:EmailPositionType Simple Type] [The value "LatestReply"] Specifies the latest reply.
[In t:EmailPositionType Simple Type] [The value "Other"] Specifies an unlisted position.
[In t:EmailPositionType Simple Type] [The value "Subject"] Specifies the subject of the email.
[In t:EmailPositionType Simple Type] [The value "Signature"] Specifies the signature of the email.
[In t:ImportanceChoicesType Simple Type] The ImportanceChoicesType simple type specifies the levels of importance for an item.

[In t:ImportanceChoicesType Simple Type] [The type ImportanceChoicesType is defined as follow:] <xs:simpleType name="ImportanceChoicesType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string" > <xs:enumeration value="High" /> <xs:enumeration value="Low" /> <xs:enumeration value="Normal" /> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType>
[In t:ImportanceChoicesType Simple Type] The following table lists the values [High, Low, Normal] that are defined by the ImportanceChoicesType simple type.
[In t:ImportanceChoicesType Simple Type] [The value "High"] Specifies high importance.
[In t:ImportanceChoicesType Simple Type] [The value "Low"] Specifies low importance.
[In t:ImportanceChoicesType Simple Type] [The value "Normal"] Specifies normal importance.
[In t:ItemClassType Simple Type] The ItemClassType simple type specifies an item class.
[In t:ItemClassType Simple Type] [The type ItemClassType is defined as follow:] <xs:simpleType name="ItemClassType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string" /> </xs:simpleType>
[In t:ReminderMinutesBeforeStartType Simple Type] The ReminderMinutesBeforeStartType simple type specifies the number of minutes before an event occurs when a reminder is displayed.

[In t:ReminderMinutesBeforeStartType Simple Type] [The type ReminderMinutesBeforeStartType is defined as follow:] <xs:simpleType name="ReminderMinutesBeforeStartType"> <xs:union> <xs:simpleType id="ReminderMinutesBeforeStartType" > <xs:restriction base="xs:int" > <xs:minInclusive value="0" /> <xs:maxInclusive value="2629800" /> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType id="ReminderMinutesBeforeStartMarkerType" > <xs:restriction base="xs:int" > <xs:minInclusive value="1525252321" /> <xs:maxInclusive value="1525252321" /> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:union> </xs:simpleType>

[In Attributes] This specification [MS-OXWSCORE] does not define any common XML schema attribute definitions.

[In Protocol Details] The client side of this protocol [MS-OXWSCORE] is simply a pass-through.
[In Protocol Details] That is, no additional timers or other state is required on the client side of this protocol [MS-OXWSCORE].

[In Protocol Details] Calls made by the higher-layer protocol or application are passed directly to the transport, and the results that are returned by the transport are passed directly back to the higher-layer protocol or application.
[In ExchangeServicePortType Server Details] The Core Items Web Service Protocol defines a single port type with six operations.
[In ExchangeServicePortType Server Details] Those operations enable client implementations to update, delete, move, or copy items on the server.

[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] The following table summarizes the WSDL operations [GetItem, CreateItem, DeleteItem, UpdateItem, MoveItem, CopyItem and MarkAllItemsAsRead] as defined by this specification [MS-OXWSCORE].
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] [The operation "GetItem"] Gets items on the server.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] [The operation "CreateItem"] Creates items on the server.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] [The operation "DeleteItem"] Deletes items on the server.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] [The operation "UpdateItem"] Updates items on the server.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] [The operation "MoveItem"] Moves items on the server.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] [The operation "CopyItem"] Copies items on the server.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] [The operation "MarkAllItemsAsRead"] Marks all the items in a folder as read.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] [The operation "MarkAsJunk"] Marks an item as junk.<104>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXWSCORE_R1787.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] [The operation "SendItem"] Sends messages and post items on the server.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] [The operation "UpdateItemInRecoverableItems"]Updates an item in the recoverable items folder.<105>
[In CopyItem Operation] The CopyItem operation copies items on the server.

[In CopyItem Operation] The following is the WSDL port type specification for the CopyItem operation: <wsdl:operation name="CopyItem" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/"> <wsdl:input message="tns:CopyItemSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:CopyItemSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>

<wsdl:operation name="CopyItem"> <soap:operation soapAction="http://schemas.microsoft.com/exchange/services/2006/messages/CopyItem"/> <wsdl:input> <soap:header message="tns:CopyItemSoapIn" part="Impersonation" use="literal"/> <soap:header message="tns:CopyItemSoapIn" part="MailboxCulture" use="literal"/> <soap:header message="tns:CopyItemSoapIn" part="RequestVersion" use="literal"/> <soap:body parts="request" use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output> <soap:body parts="CopyItemResult" use="literal"/> <soap:header message="tns:CopyItemSoapOut" part="ServerVersion" use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation>

[In m:DeleteItemType Complex Type] [The attribute "AffectedTaskOccurrences"] Specifies an enumeration value that indicates whether a task instance or a task master is to be deleted.
[In m:DeleteItemType Complex Type] The type of SuppressReadReceipts is t:boolean ([XMLSCHEMA2).
[In m:DeleteItemType Complex Type] [The attribute "SuppressReadReceipts"] Specifies whether read receipts are suppressed. <107>

[In MarkAsJunk Operation] The MarkAsJunk operation marks an item as junk.<112>

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In MarkAsJunk Operation] The following is the WSDL port type specification of the MarkAsJunk operation. <wsdl:operation name="MarkAsJunk"> <wsdl:input message="tns:MarkAsJunkSoapIn"/> <wsdl:output message="tns:MarkAsJunkSoapOut"/> </wsdl:operation>

[In tns:MarkAsJunkSoapIn Message] [The part "Impersonation"] Specifies a SOAP header that identifies the user whom the client application is impersonating.
[In tns:MarkAsJunkSoapIn Message] The type of MailboxCulture is t:MailboxCulture ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.43).
[In tns:MarkAsJunkSoapIn Message] [The part "MailboxCulture"] Specifies a SOAP header that identifies the culture to use for accessing the mailbox. The cultures are defined by [RFC3066].
[In tns:MarkAsJunkSoapIn Message] The type of RequestVersion is t:RequestServerVersion ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.3.9).
[In tns:MarkAsJunkSoapIn Message] [The part "RequestVersion"] Specifies a SOAP header that identifies the schema version for the request.
[In tns:MarkAsJunkSoapOut Message] The MarkAsJunkSoapOut WSDL message specifies the server response to a MarkAsJunkSoapIn operation request to mark an item as junk.

[In tns:MarkAsJunkSoapOut Message] The MarkAsJunkSoapOut WSDL message is the output message for the following SOAP action: http://schemas.microsoft.com/exchange/services/2006/messages/MarkAsJunk.

[In Complex Types] [The complex type "MarkAsJunkResponseType"] Specifies the response to a MarkAsJunk operation.
[In Complex Types] [The complex type "MarkAsJunkResponseMessageType"] Specifies the response message to a MarkAsJunk operation.
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] The MarkAsJunkType complex type specifies the request to mark items as junk.
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] The MarkAsJunkType complex type extends the BaseRequestType, as specified in [MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.15.

[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] [The MarkAsJunkType Complex Type is defined as:] <xs:complexType name="MarkAsJunkType"> <xs:complexContent mixed="false"> <xs:extension base="m:BaseRequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ItemIds" type="t:NonEmptyArrayOfBaseItemIdsType" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="IsJunk" type="xs:boolean" use="required" /> <xs:attribute name="MoveItem" type="xs:boolean" use="required" /> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] The following table lists the child element [ItemIds] of the MarkAsJunkType complex type.
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] The type of ItemIds is NonEmptyArraryOfBaseItemIdsType (section 2.2.4.11).
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] [The child element "ItemIds"] Specifies an array of item identifiers.
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] The following table lists the attributes [IsJunk, MoveItem] of the MarkAsJunkType complex type.
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] The type of IsJunk is xs:boolean ([XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.2).
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] [The attribute "IsJunk"] Specifies whether to mark the item as junk and add the sender to the blocked sender list.
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] The type of MoveItem is xs:boolean.
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] [The attribute "MoveItem"] Specifies whether to move the item to another folder, as described in the next table.
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] The following table describes how the attributes [IsJunk, MoveItem] affect the behavior of the MarkAsJunk operation.

[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] [When the value of "IsJunk" is] True and [the value of "MoveItem" is] True, the operation adds the sender of the email to the blocked sender list and moves the email item to the Junk Email folder.
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] [When the value of "IsJunk" is] True and [the value of "MoveItem" is] True, the operation moves the email item to the Junk Email folder.
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] [When the value of "IsJunk" is] True and [the value of "MoveItem" is] False, the operation adds the sender of the email to the blocked sender list.
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] [When the value of "IsJunk" is] True and [the value of "MoveItem" is] False, the email item is not moved.
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] [When the value of "IsJunk" is] False and [the value of "MoveItem" is] True, the operation removes the sender from the blocked sender list.
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] [When the value of "IsJunk" is] False and [the value of "MoveItem" is] True, the operation moves the email item back to the Inbox folder.
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] [When the value of "IsJunk" is] False and [the value of "MoveItem" is] False, the operation removes the sender from the blocked sender list.
[In m:MarkAsJunkType Complex Type] [When the value of "IsJunk" is] False and [the value of "MoveItem" is] False, the email item is not moved.
[In m:MarkAsJunkResponseType Complex Type] The MarkAsJunkResponseType complex type specifies the response from the MarkAsJunk operation specified in section 3.1.4.6.
[In m:MarkAsJunkResponseType Complex Type] This type [MarkAsJunkResponseType Complex Type] extends the BaseResponseMessageType, as specified in [MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.16.

[In m:MarkAsJunkResponseType Complex Type] [The MarkAsJunkResponseType Complex Type is defined as:] <xs:complexType name="MarkAsJunkResponseType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="m:BaseResponseMessageType" /> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType
[In m:MarkAsJunkResponseMessageType Complex Type] The MarkAsJunkResponseMessageType complex type specifies the response message from the MarkAsJunk operation specified in section 3.1.4.6.
[In m:MarkAsJunkResponseMessageType Complex Type] This type [MarkAsJunkResponseMessageType Complex Type] extends the ResponseMessageType complex type, as specified in [MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.65.

[In m:MarkAsJunkResponseMessageType Complex Type] [The MarkAsJunkResponseMessageType Complex Type is defined as:] <xs:complexType name="MarkAsJunkResponseMessageType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="m:ResponseMessageType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="MovedItemId" type="t:ItemIdType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In m:MarkAsJunkResponseMessageType Complex Type] The following table lists and describes the child element [MovedItemId] of the MarkAsJunkResponseMessageType complex type.
[In m:MarkAsJunkResponseMessageType Complex Type] The type of MovedItemId is t:ItemIdType (section 2.2.4.19).
[In m:MarkAsJunkResponseMessageType Complex Type] [The child element "MovedItemId"] Specifies the item identifier of the moved item.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The AppendToItemFieldType complex type specifies data to append to a single property of an item during and UpdateItem operation.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The AppendToItemFieldType complex type extends the ItemChangeDescriptionType complex type, as specified in section 3.1.4.9.3.6.

[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The AppendToItemFieldType complex type is defined as:] <xs:complexType name="AppendToItemFieldType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:ItemChangeDescriptionType" > <xs:choice> <xs:element name="Item" type="t:ItemType" /> <xs:element name="Message" type="t:MessageType" /> <xs:element name="CalendarItem" type="t:CalendarItemType" /> <xs:element name="Contact" type="t:ContactItemType" /> <xs:element name="DistributionList" type="t:DistributionListType" /> <xs:element name="MeetingMessage" type="t:MeetingMessageType" /> <xs:element name="MeetingRequest" type="t:MeetingRequestMessageType" /> <xs:element name="MeetingResponse" type="t:MeetingResponseMessageType" /> <xs:element name="MeetingCancellation" type="t:MeetingCancellationMessageType" /> <xs:element name="Task" type="t:TaskType" /> <xs:element name="PostItem" type="t:PostItemType" /> <xs:element name="RoleMember" type="t:RoleMemberItemType" /> <xs:element name="Network" type="t:NetworkItemType" /> <xs:element name="Person" type="t:AbchPersonItemType" /> <xs:element name="Booking" type="t:BookingItemType" /> <xs:element name="XrmOrganization" type="t:XrmOrganizationItemType" /> </xs:choice> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>

[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The following table lists the child elements [Item, Message, CalendarItem, Contact, DistributionList, MeetingMessage, MeetingRequest, MeetingResponse, MeetingCancellation, Task, PostItem] of the AppendToItemFieldType complex type.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The type of Item is t:ItemType (section 2.2.4.8).
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "Item"] Specifies a generic item.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The type of Message is t:MessageType ([MS-OXWSMSG] section 2.2.4.3).
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "Message"] Specifies an email message or non-IPM.Note item.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] IPM.Note is a subclass of Inter-Personal Mail (IPM), which describes a note message.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The type of CalendarItem is t:CalendarItemType ([MS-OXWSMTGS] section 2.2.4.6).
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "CalendarItem"] Specifies a calendar item.

[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "Contact"] Specifies a contact item.

[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "DistributionList"] Specifies a distribution list.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The type of MeetingMessage is t:MeetingMessageType ([MS-OXWSMTGS] section 2.2.4.15).
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "MeetingMessage"] Specifies a meeting.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The type of MeetingRequest is t:MeetingRequestMessageType ([MS-OXWSMTGS] section 2.2.4.17).
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "MeetingRequest"] Specifies a meeting request.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The type of MeetingResponse is t:MeetingResponseMessageType ([MS-OXWSMTGS] section 2.2.4.18).
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "MeetingResponse"] Specifies a meeting response.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The type of MeetingCancellation is t:MeetingCancellationMessageType ([MS-OXWSMTGS] section 2.2.4.14).
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "MeetingCancellation"] Specifies a meeting cancellation.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The type of Task is t:TaskType ([MS-OXWSTASK] section 2.2.4.6).
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "Task"] Specifies a task.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The type of PostItem is t:PostItemType ([MS-OXWSPOST] section 2.2.4.1).
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "PostItem"] Specifies a post item.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The type of RoleMember is t:RoleMemberItemType (section 2.2.4.43).
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "RoleMember"] For internal use only.<114>.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The type of Network is t:NetworkItemType (section 2.2.4.30).
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "Network"] For internal use only.<115>.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The type of Person is t:AbchPersonItemType ([MS-OXWSCONT] section 2.2.4.1).
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "Person"] Specifies a person contact.<116>.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The type of Booking is t:BookingItemType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.20).
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "Booking"] For internal use only.<118>.
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] The type of XrmOrganization is t:XrmOrganizationItemType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.77).
[In t:AppendToItemFieldType Complex Type] [The element "XrmOrganization"] For internal use only.<107>.

[In t:ChangeDescriptionType Complex Type] The ChangeDescriptionType complex type specifies the base type that is used to describe changes in UpdateFolder operation, as specified in [MS-OXWSFOLD] section 3.1.4.8 ,and UpdateItem operation, as specified in (section 3.1.4.9).

[In t:ItemChangeType Complex Type] The ItemChangeType complex type specifies an item identifier and the updates to apply to the item.

[In t:ItemChangeType Complex Type] [The ItemChangeType complex type is defined as:] <xs:complexType name="ItemChangeType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="ItemId" type="t:ItemIdType" /> <xs:element name="OccurrenceItemId" type="t:OccurrenceItemIdType" /> <xs:element name="RecurringMasterItemId" type="t:RecurringMasterItemIdType" /> </xs:choice> <xs:element name="Updates" type="t:NonEmptyArrayOfItemChangeDescriptionsType" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:ItemChangeType Complex Type] The following table lists the child elements [ItemId, OccurrenceItemId, RecurringMasterItemId, Updates] of the ItemChangeType complex type.
[In t:ItemChangeType Complex Type] The type of ItemId is t:ItemIdType (section 2.2.4.19).

[In t:ItemChangeType Complex Type] The type of Updates is t:NonEmptyArrayOfItemChangeDescriptionsType (section 3.1.4.9.3.8).
[In t:ItemChangeType Complex Type] [The element "Updates"] Specifies an array that defines append, set, and delete changes to item properties.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfItemChangeDescriptionsType Complex Type] The NonEmptyArrayOfItemChangeDescriptionsType complex type specifies an array of items and their change types.

[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfItemChangeDescriptionsType Complex Type] [The element "SetItemField"] Specifies an update to a single property of an item in an UpdateItem operation.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfItemChangeDescriptionsType Complex Type] The type of DeleteItemField is t:DeleteItemFieldType (section 3.1.4.9.3.5).

[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfItemChangeDescriptionsType Complex Type] [The element "DeleteItemField" with type "t:DeleteItemFieldType"] Specifies an operation to delete a given property from an item during an UpdateItem operation.

[In Simple Types] The following table lists the XML schema simple type definitions [ConflictResolutionType] that are specific to the UpdateItem operation.
[In Simple Types] [The simply type "ConflictResolutionType"] Specifies how a conflict is to be handled during an UpdateItem operation.
[In t:ConflictResolutionType Simple Type] The ConflictResolutionType simple type specifies how a conflict is to be handled during an UpdateItem operation.

[In t:ConflictResolutionType Simple Type] [The ConflictResolutionType simple type is defined as:] <xs:simpleType name="ConflictResolutionType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string" > <xs:enumeration value="AlwaysOverwrite" /> <xs:enumeration value="AutoResolve" /> <xs:enumeration value="NeverOverwrite" /> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType>
[In t:ConflictResolutionType Simple Type] The following table lists the values [AlwaysOverwrite, AutoResolve, NeverOverwrite] that are defined by the ConflictResolutionType simple type.
[In t:ConflictResolutionType Simple Type] [The ConflictResolutionType value is AlwaysOverwrite] If there is a conflict, the UpdateItem operation will overwrite information.
[In t:ConflictResolutionType Simple Type] [The ConflictResolutionType value is AutoResolve] The UpdateItem operation automatically resolves any conflict.
[In t:ConflictResolutionType Simple Type] [The ConflictResolutionType value is AutoResolve] The "AutoResolve" option will in most cases overwrite the existing value for a property.
[In t:ConflictResolutionType Simple Type] [The ConflictResolutionType value is AutoResolve] In some cases, the new value is ignored and the original value is retained.

[In t:ConflictResolutionType Simple Type] [The ConflictResolutionType value is AutoResolve] For example, user A changes the value of the Sensitivity property from "Normal" to "Confidential", and then user B sets that value to "Public".

[In t:ConflictResolutionType Simple Type] [The ConflictResolutionType value is AutoResolve] In this example [user A changes the value of the Sensitivity property from "Normal" to "Confidential", and then user B sets that value to "Public" .], the "Confidential" setting is retained and user B's update is ignored.
[In t:ConflictResolutionType Simple Type] [ConflictResolutionType value is NeverOverwrite] If there is a conflict, the UpdateItem operation fails and an error is returned.
[In UpdateItemInRecoverableItems Operation] The UpdateItemInRecoverableItems operation updates an item in the recoverable items folder.<124>

[In UpdateItemInRecoverableItems Operation] The following is the WSDL port type specification for the UpdateItemInRecoverableItems operation. <wsdl:operation name="UpdateItemInRecoverableItems"> <wsdl:input message="tns:UpdateItemInRecoverableItemsSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:UpdateItemInRecoverableItemsSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>

[In Messages] [The message "UpdateItemInRecoverableItemsSoapIn"] Specifies the SOAP message that requests that recoverable items be updated.
[In Messages] [The message "UpdateItemInRecoverableItemsSoapOut"] Specifies the SOAP message that is returned in response to an UpdateItemInRecoverableItems operation request.

[In tns:UpdateItemInRecoverableItemsSoapIn] The type of ManagementRole is t:ManagementRole (section 2.2.3.1).
[In tns:UpdateItemInRecoverableItemsSoapIn] [The part "ManagementRole" with element "t:ManagementRole"] Specifies the roles the user or application wants to use.

[In Appendix C: Product Behavior] Unless otherwise specified, any statement of optional behavior in this specification that is prescribed using the terms SHOULD or SHOULD NOT implies product behavior in accordance with the SHOULD or SHOULD NOT prescription.
[In Appendix C: Product Behavior] Implementation does use secure communications via HTTPS, as defined in [RFC2818]. (Exchange 2007 and above follow this behavior.)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Appendix C: Product Behavior] Unless otherwise specified, the term MAY implies that the product does not follow the prescription.

[In Appendix C: Product Behavior] Implementation does support ArrayOfContactsType complex type which specifies the type of a contact. (Exchange 2013 and above follow this behavior.)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

[In Appendix C: Product Behavior] Implementation does support EmailAddressEntityType complex type which specifies an email address entity. (Exchange 2013 and above follow this behavior.)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.
